intro: Hemsleya graciliflora var. tianmuensis, commonly known as the Tianmu mountain arrowhead, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Araceae family and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and striking white spatulate flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments within mountain forests. It is noted for its ornamental value and is occasionally cultivated for horticultural purposes. Its botanical features make it a unique and interesting subject for plant enthusiasts and researchers.
